mlflex
Class DataInstanceCollection

java.lang.Object
  mlflex.DataInstanceCollection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<DataValues>
public class DataInstanceCollection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<DataValues>

This class is designed to store all data for a set of data instances. It provides methods that make it easier to create, retrieve, update, and delete data values for these instances.

Author:
Stephen Piccolo

BinarizeDataPoint

public DataInstanceCollection BinarizeDataPoint(java.lang.String dataPointName,
                                                java.lang.String oneOption)
For a given data point, this method converts values to zero or one, depending on whether they coincide with the specified value.

Parameters:
dataPointName - Data point name
oneOption - Value that corresponds to a "1" binary value (other values will be converted to "0"
Returns:
Binarized value

GetUniqueValues

KeepDataPoints

public DataInstanceCollection KeepDataPoints(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> toKeep)

Parameters:

Returns:
This collection after filtering

KeepInstances

public DataInstanceCollection KeepInstances(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> idsToKeep)
Retains only the data instances with IDs in the specified list. All others are removed.

Parameters:
idsToKeep - List of IDs that should be retained
Returns:
This collection after filtering

PermuteIDs

public static DataInstanceCollection PermuteIDs(DataInstanceCollection instances)
This method can be used to permute the data instances IDs in a collection. This should have a similar effect to permuting class labels. It can be used for validation experiments.

Parameters:
instances - Data instances to be permuted
Returns:
Permuted data instances

                            java.lang.String instanceID,
                            java.lang.String value)

Parameters:
dataPointName - Data point to be updated
instanceID - Data instance ID

UpdateDataPointName

                                java.lang.String toDataPointName)
Changes an existing data point name to the specified value.

Parameters:
fromDataPointName - Current data point name
toDataPointName - New data point name

UpdateDataPoints

public void UpdateDataPoints(java.lang.String dataPointName,
                             DataValues values)
Updates a given data point with the specified values.

Parameters:
dataPointName - Data point to be updated
values - The values for each instance that will be updated

UpdateInstance

public void UpdateInstance(DataValues instance)
Replaces an existing data instance with the specified data instance. If the data instance does not exist in this collection, the specified instance is added.

Parameters:
instance - Replacement data instance
